column4: I'm trying to install "nvidia-glx" through synaptic and before the file even downloads a dialogue pops up asking me to put the Ubunutu Installation CD in the drive.  I do, then press "ok" and nothing happens....any ideas?...
it's using your CD as a repo...bets to disable it and just use net repos
I'm sorry if this is an inane question...but, how do I do what you have suggested?
do you know how to use synaptic/apt-get ?
not really
sys > admin > synaptic
I understand if you don't want to explain it.  I believe I saw a tuturial on apt-get in the wiki.
no, no biggie.....the wiki probably would explain it better anyway :)
thank you though
but what you're doing is very easy, i can walk you through
open a terminal
sudo gedit /etc/apt/sources.list
type that
did a file open up?
see the top line.... it should have CD there somewhere
comment it out by putting a # character at the start of the line
you might want to enable universe and multiverse while you're at it
yep, you can do that by removing the # character at the start of these two lines:
thank you very much
no probs, save and close
then type: sudo apt-get update
